intro: Dilomilis serrata, commonly known as the serrated dilomilis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have serrated edges, contributing to its common name. Dilomilis serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth areas.
